strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<se_high>*: The Princess rescued all of the monsters here from hunger, hurt and hardship!
<se_high>*: Can you believe it!? She helps us even though we're monsters! The girl's a mini miracle!
<se_def>*: I want to be of some use to the Princess, but that means leaving her side to search for medals.
<se_def>*: It's just too painful! I don't know if I could bear to spend even one day away from her!
<se_def>*: So I've decided to try serenading her instead. Maybe my voice will make her happy and I won't have to leave. Doremini! ♪
<se_high>*: Aaaaah. It's been a long day. Sleep time...
<se_def>*: I tried seranading the Princess with heavy-medal music, but her maid got angry and said it sounded like I was strangling a cat!
<se_def>*: I suppose I was partly in the wrong for singing when the King was asleep, but there was no need to be quite so harsh.
<se_def>*: I'm sure the Princess would have asked me to stop in a much more gracious way...
<se_def>*: That monster of a maid isn't a patch on her.
<se_def>*: It seems I must admit defeat when it comes to making the Princess happy.
<se_def>*: My songs could never make her smile as much as you just did...
<se_def>*: But I mustn't fret! The main thing is that she's happy. It doesn't matter to me who made her that way.
<se_def>*: It's funny, but that maid who serves the King hasn't been shouting at me lately. She seems a lot happier all of a sudden...
<se_def>*: She was probably just a bit tense before, what with the King's ill health and everything.
<se_def>*: I suppose I was a bit unfair when I called her a monster. She's not all that bad really.
